p: The only work published about the chemical composition of the aerial parts essential oils of R. acaule reported its richness in oxygenated sesquiterpenes (21.3%), aromatic compounds (23.6%) and diterpenoids (23.7%) [ 16]. In the same work, it was also found that the essential oil exhibited an interesting antibacterial activity [ 16]. However, to the best of our knowledge and according to literature, there are no reports on the antioxidant activities and enzyme inhibition effects of the essential oil from R. acaule.
